Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Attorney General Reaches $1.86 Million Settlement with Emeritus Corp.; National Leader in Assisted Living Falsely Billed Medicaid, States News Service, August 28, 2007 (via Nexis).

Company: Emeritus Corporation, dba Emeritus Senior Living
Description: Emeritus, an operator of assisted living facilities now owned by Brookdale Senior Living, agreed to pay $587,400 to the federal government for failing to return overpayments it received from Medicaid services. It also paid $391,600 to 18 states (see separate Violation Tracker entry).
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-wdwa/pr/assisted-living-chain-emeritus-settles-allegations-overbilling-government-programs

Company: Emeritus Corporation, dba Emeritus Senior Living
Description: Emeritus, an operator of assisted living facilities now owned by Brookdale Senior Living, agreed to pay $391,600 to 18 states for failing to return overpayments it received from Medicaid services. This was part of a larger $979,000 settlement involving the federal government.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-wdwa/pr/assisted-living-chain-emeritus-settles-allegations-overbilling-government-programs
